info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 1:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert and southern Lincoln Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers and possible thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Hanover to 6 miles north of Sugar City, or along a line extending from 26 miles southeast of Colorado Springs to 24 miles north of North La Junta. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could produce blowing dust, poor visibility, and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kutch, Karval, Wild Horse Point, Forder and Punkin Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
